alert.note: Alert for Western Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 5:21AM AKST until February 14 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...Western Aleutians. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 9 PM AKST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions, with whiteout conditions at times. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could damage property and cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong front will approach from the south late this morning with temperatures initially near or below freezing, allowing precipitation along the front to fall as snow. Winds will drop off quickly as the front moves through this evening and as snow begins to mix with rain, leading to rapidly improving conditions.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
